intro: Tuctoria, commonly known as the sea blush or sea holly, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Crambe. It is native to the coastal regions of Europe and North Africa, where it thrives in saline and sandy soils. Tuctoria has a low-growing habit with silver-gray leaves that are covered in fine hairs. It is often used in coastal landscaping due to its hardiness and ornamental value.
